channel.title: Echoing the amount of lines in a text file? php
channel.description:
[s]How can I use php to echo the amount of lines in a text file e.g.
[code=file.txt] 1 line 2 info 3 [/code]
then the it would echo 3 because there is 3 lines?[/s]
[b]nvm i got it![/b]

item.title: Echoing the amount of lines in a text file? php
item.dc:creator: @tehjamdude tehjamdude
item.description:
@tehjamdude wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:6, topic:524573”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=643122.msg4330220#msg4330220 date=1373554940]

In case anybody else is curious, you could just count the occurrences of the \n character (seeing as OP didn’t post his solution).

arcik is a he
[/quote]

Don’t refer to me, don’t use my name, don’t act like you know me. You just another kid with a dildo up their ass and need to start talking relevant things.[/quote]

He didn’t say anything wrong, If it is possible can you post your code? If you found out how todo it, maybe you can help others by doing so.

  • James

item.title: Echoing the amount of lines in a text file? php
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:4, topic:524573”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=643122.msg4330031#msg4330031 date=1373509585]
In case anybody else is curious, you could just count the occurrences of the \n character (seeing as OP didn’t post his solution).
[/quote]
arcik is a he[/quote]Ok?

[quote=“Arcik, post:3, topic:524573”]$lines = count(file($file));[/quote]Forgot about the files function. If the files are going to be large, you may want to use some sort of buffer instead of loading it all into memory.
